alert.note: Alert for Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 29 at 10:32PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT/1100 PM EDT/ FOR NORTHEASTERN WARRICK...SPENCER AND SOUTHEASTERN PIKE COUNTIES... At 932 PM CDT/1032 PM EDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located over Folsomville, or 8 miles northeast of Boonville, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Dale, Lynnville, Grandview, Santa Claus, Folsomville, Chrisney, Tennyson, Gentryville and Spurgeon. This includes Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 37 and 60. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
